meanings.definition: The fee or commission charged by a broker for their services.
meanings.sent1: The brokage for selling the house was reasonable.
meanings.sent2: She paid a brokage to the real estate agent for finding her a new apartment.
meanings.sent3: The brokage for brokering the deal was worth every penny.
meanings.sent4: His brokage was like a small thank-you gift for connecting the buyer and seller.
meanings.sent5: The brokage was clearly stated in the contract to avoid any misunderstandings.

meanings.definition: The act of acting as a broker or intermediary in a transaction.
meanings.sent1: His brokage in the stock market was successful.
meanings.sent2: She took on the brokage of the business deal with confidence.
meanings.sent3: The brokage of the negotiation was smooth and efficient.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, brokage plays a crucial role.
meanings.sent5: The brokage of the trade was handled professionally by the experienced broker.
